name: CloudVault
description: Clean, minimal cloud storage for efficient file management and collaboration.

current_prd.elevator_pitch: CloudVault offers a clean, minimal cloud storage solution for individuals and teams. We solve the problem of cluttered and inefficient file management by providing an intuitive interface for uploading, organizing, previewing, and sharing files, enhancing productivity and collaboration with a professional, modern experience.
current_prd.problem_statement: Users struggle with cluttered, inefficient cloud storage interfaces that hinder productivity, make file organization difficult, and lack intuitive features for quick access and collaboration.
current_prd.solution: CloudVault provides a clean, minimal, and efficient cloud storage interface. It enables users to seamlessly upload, organize, preview, and share files through an intuitive layout featuring a folder tree, flexible grid/list views, drag-and-drop upload support, and a powerful search bar. This design prioritizes clarity, responsiveness, and productivity, offering a professional experience akin to modern cloud-based productivity applications.

key_features.feature_description: Users can upload single or multiple files and folders via a dedicated upload button or drag-and-drop functionality.
Users can create, rename, move, and delete folders and files, with a hierarchical folder tree for navigation.
Users can view various file types (documents, images, videos) directly within the interface without downloading.
Users can generate shareable links with customizable permissions (view-only, edit, password protection, expiry dates).
Users can switch between grid and list views for displaying files and folders, with options for sorting.
A prominent search bar allows users to quickly find files and folders by name, type, or tags.
Robust backend APIs for file storage, retrieval, and management, ensuring data integrity and availability.
Scalable architecture to handle increasing storage demands and user traffic without performance degradation.
End-to-end encryption for data at rest and in transit, access controls, and regular security audits.
Admin dashboard for managing user accounts, storage quotas, and system settings.
Reporting tools for storage usage, user activity, and system performance.
Tools for monitoring system health, error logging, and performance metrics.
Automated deployment pipelines, backup and recovery mechanisms, and customer support tools.

current_prd.success_metrics: Increase user adoption by 25% within the first year. Achieve a 90% user satisfaction rating for file management features. Maintain an average file upload/download speed of under 5 seconds for files under 1GB. Ensure 99.9% uptime for the service.
current_prd.competitors: Dropbox, Google Drive, OneDrive, Box, iCloud Drive
current_prd.vision: To become the most intuitive and efficient cloud storage solution, empowering individuals and teams to manage their digital assets effortlessly, fostering seamless collaboration and maximizing productivity.

target_audience.name: Individual Professionals
target_audience.pain_points: Cluttered existing cloud storage, difficulty finding specific files, concerns about data privacy and security, slow upload/download speeds.
target_audience.demographics: Ages 25-55, tech-savvy, working remotely or in hybrid environments, often managing personal and work files.
target_audience.needs_and_goals: Efficiently store, organize, and access personal and professional documents; secure sharing for collaborations; quick file retrieval.

target_audience.name: Small to Medium-sized Businesses (SMBs)
target_audience.pain_points: Lack of a unified platform for team files, difficulty in managing access permissions, compliance concerns, inefficient collaboration tools, high costs of enterprise solutions.
target_audience.demographics: Businesses with 10-250 employees, across various industries, requiring collaborative file management.
target_audience.needs_and_goals: Centralized file storage for teams; secure collaboration and document versioning; easy sharing with clients and partners; administrative control over user access and data.

phasing.rationale: This phase delivers the absolute core functionality for a user to store and manage their files. It's a functional, albeit basic, cloud storage solution that can be launched to early adopters to gather feedback. The 'Cloud Storage Infrastructure' is fundamental and makes the other features possible and reliable.

Builds upon the core storage by adding critical features for productivity and collaboration. File preview enhances the user experience significantly, and file sharing is essential for team environments, making it suitable for a beta launch to a wider audience.

This phase focuses on making CloudVault ready for broader adoption, especially for teams and organizations. It introduces administrative controls, robust security measures, and ensures the platform can handle growth, moving from beta to a full production launch.

These features are crucial for the long-term health, maintenance, and support of the CloudVault platform. While not directly user-facing in the same way as file management, they are vital for operational teams, ensuring stability, performance, and customer satisfaction post-launch. This phase makes the product operationally mature and provides tools for internal teams.

current_prd.design_principles:
Clarity & Simplicity: A clean, minimal interface that prioritizes essential functions and reduces visual clutter.
Efficiency & Productivity: Streamlined workflows, quick access to files, and responsive interactions to maximize user productivity.
Responsiveness & Accessibility: Ensures a consistent and usable experience across various devices and screen sizes, adhering to accessibility standards.
Professional & Modern Aesthetic: A sophisticated and contemporary design language that aligns with leading cloud-based productivity applications.

user_stories.title: File Upload via Button

user_story.i_want: to upload single or multiple files using a dedicated button
user_story.so_that: I can quickly add documents to my cloud storage without interruption.

acceptance_criteria: User can click an 'Upload' button.
User can select one or more files from their local system.
Upload progress is clearly displayed for each file.
Uploaded files appear in the current folder view upon completion.
System handles large file uploads efficiently.
System provides feedback on upload success or failure.

user_stories.title: Drag-and-Drop File Upload

user_story.i_want: to upload files and folders by dragging and dropping them
user_story.so_that: I can quickly and intuitively add content to my storage without navigating through menus.

acceptance_criteria: User can drag and drop one or more files or folders from their local system into the application interface.
A visual indicator shows the drop zone when dragging files.
Upload progress is displayed for each item.
Uploaded files/folders appear in the current folder view upon completion.
System provides feedback on upload success or failure.

user_stories.title: File and Folder Management

user_story.i_want: to organize my files and folders efficiently
user_story.so_that: I can easily find and manage my content.

acceptance_criteria: User can create a new folder within the current directory.
User can rename existing files and folders.
User can move files and folders between different directories using drag-and-drop or a context menu.
User can delete files and folders, with a confirmation prompt.
The hierarchical folder tree updates in real-time to reflect changes.
System prevents creation of folders with duplicate names in the same directory.

user_stories.title: In-App File Preview

user_story.i_want: to preview various file types directly within the application
user_story.so_that: I can quickly review content without needing to download files or switch applications.

acceptance_criteria: User can click on a file to open a preview window.
The preview window supports common document types (e.g., PDF, DOCX, XLSX).
The preview window supports common image formats (e.g., JPG, PNG, GIF).
The preview window supports common video formats (e.g., MP4, MOV).
The preview window loads quickly and displays content accurately.
User can close the preview window easily.

user_stories.title: Secure File Sharing with Permissions

user_story.i_want: to share files and folders securely with customizable permissions
user_story.so_that: I can control who accesses my content and for how long.

acceptance_criteria: User can select a file or folder and initiate a sharing action.
User can generate a shareable link with default view-only permissions.
User can set the link to allow editing access.
User can add password protection to the shared link.
User can set an expiry date for the shared link.
User can easily copy the generated link to their clipboard.
User can revoke access to a shared link at any time.

user_stories.title: Flexible File Display Views

user_story.i_want: to switch between grid and list views for my files and folders
user_story.so_that: I can choose the most efficient way to browse and locate my content.

acceptance_criteria: User can toggle between a grid view and a list view for files and folders.
In grid view, thumbnails are displayed for visual content.
In list view, file details (name, size, last modified, owner) are clearly visible.
User can sort files and folders by name, date modified, size, and type in both views.
The selected view and sort order persist across sessions.

user_stories.title: Quick File Search

user_story.i_want: to quickly find specific files or folders
user_story.so_that: I can access my content without manually browsing through directories.

acceptance_criteria: A prominent search bar is visible at the top of the interface.
User can type keywords into the search bar.
Search results are displayed in real-time as the user types.
Search results include files and folders matching the keywords by name, type, or tags.
User can click on a search result to navigate directly to the file or folder location.
Search functionality is fast and accurate, even with a large number of files.

user_stories.title: Robust Cloud Storage Backend

user_story.i_want: a reliable and secure cloud storage infrastructure
user_story.so_that: we can ensure data integrity, availability, and high performance for all users.

acceptance_criteria: The system provides robust APIs for uploading, downloading, and managing files.
Data is stored securely and redundantly across multiple servers.
File retrieval is fast and reliable.
The system ensures data integrity and prevents corruption.
The backend infrastructure can handle a high volume of concurrent requests.

user_stories.title: Scalable Storage Architecture

user_story.so_that: we can accommodate future growth in data and user traffic without compromising performance.

acceptance_criteria: The system architecture is designed to scale horizontally and vertically.
The system can handle a significant increase in stored data without performance degradation.
The system can accommodate a growing number of active users without impacting responsiveness.
New storage resources can be added seamlessly without downtime.
Performance metrics remain within acceptable thresholds during peak loads.

user_stories.title: End-to-End Data Security

user_story.i_want: to ensure all data is protected with end-to-end encryption and robust access controls
user_story.so_that: we can maintain data confidentiality, integrity, and compliance with regulations.

acceptance_criteria: All data at rest is encrypted using industry-standard algorithms.
All data in transit is encrypted using secure protocols (e.g., TLS).
Access to files and folders is controlled by a robust permission system.
Regular security audits are conducted to identify and address vulnerabilities.
The system adheres to relevant data protection regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).

user_stories.title: Admin User Account Management

user_story.i_want: to manage user accounts and storage quotas efficiently
user_story.so_that: I can control access to the system and allocate resources effectively.

acceptance_criteria: Admin can access a dedicated dashboard for user management.
Admin can create new user accounts and assign initial storage quotas.
Admin can modify existing user accounts, including changing passwords and updating quotas.
Admin can delete user accounts, with a confirmation prompt.
Admin can view a list of all active and inactive user accounts.
Admin actions are logged for auditing purposes.

user_stories.title: Admin Usage and Performance Reporting

user_story.i_want: to monitor storage usage and system performance
user_story.so_that: I can make informed decisions about resource allocation and identify areas for optimization.

acceptance_criteria: Admin can view reports on overall storage usage.
Admin can view reports on individual user storage consumption.
Admin can view reports on user activity (e.g., uploads, downloads, shares).
Reports are presented in a clear and understandable format (e.g., charts, tables).
Admin can filter and export reports for further analysis.
Reports provide insights into system performance and potential bottlenecks.

user_stories.title: System Health Monitoring and Alerting

user_story.i_want: to monitor system health and receive alerts for critical issues
user_story.so_that: we can proactively identify and resolve problems before they impact users.

acceptance_criteria: The system continuously monitors key health metrics (e.g., server uptime, disk space, CPU usage).
Automated alerts are triggered when predefined thresholds are exceeded.
Alerts are sent to the technical operations team via multiple channels (e.g., email, SMS).
Error logs are generated and stored for debugging and analysis.
The monitoring system provides a dashboard for real-time visibility into system status.

user_stories.title: Technical Operations and Support Tools

user_story.i_want: to have robust tools for deployment, backup, recovery, and customer support
user_story.so_that: we can ensure smooth operations, minimize downtime, and provide effective assistance to users.

acceptance_criteria: Automated pipelines are in place for deploying new features and updates.
Regular backups of all user data and system configurations are performed.
A clear and tested disaster recovery plan is in place for data restoration.
Customer support tools allow support agents to access relevant user information (with consent) to assist with issues.
Documentation for technical operations procedures is comprehensive and up-to-date.

planned.model_content:
class Share < ApplicationRecord
  belongs_to :organization
  belongs_to :creator, class_name: 'User'
  belongs_to :document, optional: true
  belongs_to :folder, optional: true

  validates :token, presence: true, uniqueness: true
  validates :access_level, presence: true, inclusion: { in: %w[view edit] }
  validate :one_shareable_present

  rhino_owner :organization
  rhino_references [:organization, :creator, :document, :folder]

  private

  def one_shareable_present
    if document_id.blank? && folder_id.blank?
      errors.add(:base, "Must share either a document or a folder.")
    elsif document_id.present? && folder_id.present?
      errors.add(:base, "Cannot share both a document and a folder with one link.")
    end
  end
end
